verses.verse: And the whole <WG537> multitude <WG4128> of them arose, <WG450> and led <WG71> him to Pilate. <WG4091>

And they began <WG756> to accuse <WG2723> him, saying, <WG3004> We found <WG2147> this <WG5126> fellow perverting <WG1294> the nation, <WG1484> and forbidding <WG2967> to give <WG1325> tribute <WG5411> to Caesar, <WG2541> saying <WG3004> that he himself <WG1438> is Christ <WG5547> a King. <WG935>
And Pilate <WG4091> asked <WG1905> him, saying, <WG3004> Are <WG1488> you the King <WG935> of the Jews? <WG2453> And he answered <WG611> him and said, <WG5346> You say <WG3004> it.
Then <WG1161> said <WG2036> Pilate <WG4091> to the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and to the people, <WG3793> I find <WG2147> no <WG3762> fault <WG158> in this <WG5129> man. <WG444>

And they were the more <WG2001> fierce, <WG2001> saying, <WG3004> He stirs <WG383> up the people, <WG2992> teaching <WG1321> throughout <WG2596> all <WG3650> Jewry, <WG2449> beginning <WG756> from Galilee <WG1056> to this <WG5602> place. <WG5602>
When Pilate <WG4091> heard <WG191> of Galilee, <WG1056> he asked <WG1905> whether <WG1487> the man <WG444> were a Galilaean. <WG1057>

And as soon as he knew <WG1921> that he belonged <WG1510> to Herod's <WG2264> jurisdiction, <WG1849> he sent <WG375> him to Herod, <WG2264> who himself <WG846> also <WG2532> was at <WG1722> Jerusalem <WG2414> at <WG1722> that time. <WG2250>

And when Herod <WG2264> saw <WG1492> Jesus, <WG2424> he was exceeding <WG3029> glad: <WG5463> for he was desirous <WG2309> to see <WG1492> him of a long <WG2425> season, because <WG1223> he had heard <WG191> many <WG4183> things of him; and he hoped <WG1679> to have seen <WG1492> some <WG5100> miracle <WG4592> done <WG1096> by him.
Then <WG1161> he questioned <WG1905> with him in many <WG2425> words; <WG3056> but he answered <WG611> him nothing. <WG3762>
And the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and scribes <WG1122> stood <WG2476> and vehemently <WG2159> accused <WG2723> him.

And Herod <WG2264> with his men <WG4753> of war <WG4753> set <WG1848> him at <WG1848> nothing, <WG1848> and mocked <WG1702> him, and arrayed <WG4016> him in a gorgeous <WG2986> robe, <WG2066> and sent <WG375> him again <WG375> to Pilate. <WG4091>

And the same <WG846> day <WG2250> Pilate <WG4091> and Herod <WG2264> were made <WG1096> friends <WG5384> together: <WG3326> <WG240> for before <WG4391> they were at <WG1722> enmity <WG2189> between <WG4314> themselves. <WG1438>
And Pilate, <WG4091> when he had called <WG4779> together <WG4779> the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the rulers <WG758> and the people, <WG2992>

Said <WG2036> to them, You have brought <WG4374> this <WG5129> man <WG444> to me, as one that perverts <WG654> the people: <WG2992> and, behold, <WG2400> I, having examined <WG350> him before <WG1799> you, have found <WG2147> no <WG3762> fault <WG158> in this <WG5126> man <WG444> touching those things whereof you accuse <WG2723> him:
No, <WG235> nor <WG3761> yet Herod: <WG2264> for I sent <WG375> you to him; and, see, <WG2400> nothing <WG3762> worthy <WG514> of death <WG2288> is done <WG4238> to him.
I will therefore <WG3767> chastise <WG3811> him, and release <WG630> him.
(For of necessity <WG2192> <WG318> he must release <WG630> one <WG1520> to them at <WG2596> the feast. <WG1859>)
And they cried <WG349> out all <WG3829> at <WG3826> once, <WG3826> saying, <WG3004> Away with this <WG5126> man, and release <WG630> to us Barabbas: <WG912>
(Who <WG3748> for a certain <WG5100> sedition <WG4714> made <WG1096> in the city, <WG4172> and for murder, <WG5408> was cast <WG906> into <WG1519> prison. <WG5438>)
Pilate <WG4091> therefore, <WG3767> willing <WG2309> to release <WG630> Jesus, <WG2424> spoke <WG4377> again <WG3825> to them.
But they cried, <WG2019> saying, <WG3004> Crucify <WG4717> him, crucify <WG4717> him.

And he said <WG2036> to them the third <WG5154> time, Why, <WG1063> what <WG5101> evil <WG2556> has he done? <WG4160> I have found <WG2147> no <WG3762> cause <WG158> of death <WG2288> in him: I will therefore <WG3767> chastise <WG3811> him, and let him go. <WG630>

And they were instant <WG1945> with loud <WG3173> voices, <WG5456> requiring <WG154> that he might be crucified. <WG4717> And the voices <WG5456> of them and of the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> prevailed. <WG2729>
And Pilate <WG4091> gave sentence <WG1948> that it should be as they required. <WG155>

And he released <WG630> to them him that for sedition <WG4714> and murder <WG5408> was cast <WG906> into <WG1519> prison, <WG5438> whom <WG3739> they had desired; <WG154> but he delivered <WG3860> Jesus <WG2424> to their will. <WG2307>

And as they led <WG520> him away, <WG520> they laid hold <WG1949> on one <WG5100> Simon, <WG4613> a Cyrenian, <WG2956> coming <WG2064> out of the country, <WG68> and on <WG2007> him they laid <WG2007> the cross, <WG4716> that he might bear <WG5342> it after <WG3693> Jesus. <WG2424>
And there followed <WG190> him a great <WG4183> company <WG4128> of people, <WG2992> and of women, <WG1135> which <WG3739> also <WG2532> bewailed <WG2875> and lamented <WG2354> him.

But Jesus <WG2424> turning <WG4762> to them said, <WG2036> Daughters <WG2364> of Jerusalem, <WG2419> weep <WG2799> not for me, but weep <WG2799> for yourselves, <WG1438> and for your <WG5216> children. <WG5043>

For, behold, <WG2400> the days <WG2250> are coming, <WG2064> in the which <WG3739> they shall say, <WG2046> Blessed <WG3107> are the barren, <WG4723> and the wombs <WG2836> that never <WG3756> bore, <WG1080> and the breasts <WG3149> which <WG3739> never <WG3756> gave suck. <WG2337>
Then <WG5119> shall they begin <WG756> to say <WG3004> to the mountains, <WG3735> Fall <WG4098> on <WG1909> us; and to the hills, <WG1015> Cover <WG2572> us.
For if <WG1487> they do <WG4160> these <WG5023> things in a green <WG5200> tree, <WG3586> what <WG5101> shall be done <WG1096> in the dry? <WG3584>
And there were also <WG2532> two <WG1417> other, <WG2087> malefactors, <WG2557> led <WG71> with him to be put <WG337> to death. <WG337>

And when <WG3753> they were come <WG565> to the place, <WG5117> which <WG3588> is called <WG2564> Calvary, <WG2898> there <WG1563> they crucified <WG4717> him, and the malefactors, <WG2557> one <WG3739> <WG3303> on <WG1537> the right <WG1188> hand, and the other <WG3739> on <WG1537> the left. <WG710>

Then <WG1161> said <WG3004> Jesus, <WG2424> Father, <WG3962> forgive <WG863> them; for they know <WG1492> not what <WG5101> they do. <WG4160> And they parted <WG1266> his raiment, <WG2440> and cast <WG906> lots. <WG2819>

And the people <WG2992> stood <WG2476> beholding. <WG2334> And the rulers <WG758> also <WG2532> with them derided <WG1592> him, saying, <WG3004> He saved <WG4982> others; <WG243> let him save <WG4982> himself, <WG1438> if <WG1487> he be Christ, <WG5547> the chosen <WG1588> of God. <WG2316>
And the soldiers <WG4757> also <WG2532> mocked <WG1702> him, coming <WG4334> to him, and offering <WG4374> him vinegar, <WG3690>
And saying, <WG3004> If <WG1487> you be the king <WG935> of the Jews, <WG2453> save <WG4982> yourself. <WG4572>

And a superscription <WG1923> also <WG2532> was written <WG1125> over <WG1909> him in letters <WG1121> of Greek, <WG1673> and Latin, <WG4513> and Hebrew, <WG1444> THIS <WG3778> IS THE KING <WG935> OF THE JEWS. <WG2453>
And one <WG1520> of the malefactors <WG2557> which were hanged <WG2910> railed <WG987> on him, saying, <WG3004> If <WG1487> you be Christ, <WG5547> save <WG4982> yourself <WG4572> and us.
But the other <WG2087> answering <WG611> rebuked <WG2008> him, saying, <WG3004> Do not you fear <WG5399> God, <WG2316> seeing <WG3754> you are <WG1488> in the same <WG846> condemnation? <WG2917>
And we indeed <WG3303> justly; <WG1346> for we receive <WG618> the due <WG514> reward <WG514> of our deeds: <WG3739> <WG4238> but this <WG3778> man has done <WG4238> nothing <WG3762> amiss. <WG824>
And he said <WG3004> to Jesus, <WG2424> Lord, <WG2962> remember <WG3415> me when <WG3752> you come <WG2064> into <WG1722> your kingdom. <WG932>
And Jesus <WG2424> said <WG2036> to him, Truly <WG281> I say <WG3004> to you, To day <WG4594> shall you be with me in paradise. <WG3857>
And it was about <WG5616> the sixth <WG1623> hour, <WG5610> and there was a darkness <WG4655> over <WG1909> all <WG3650> the earth <WG1093> until <WG2193> the ninth <WG1766> hour. <WG5610>
And the sun <WG2246> was darkened, <WG4654> and the veil <WG2665> of the temple <WG3485> was rent <WG4977> in the middle. <WG3319>

And when Jesus <WG2424> had cried <WG5455> with a loud <WG3173> voice, <WG5456> he said, <WG2036> Father, <WG3962> into <WG1519> your hands <WG5495> I commend <WG3908> my spirit: <WG4151> and having said <WG2036> thus, <WG3778> he gave up the ghost. <WG1606>

Now <WG1161> when the centurion <WG1543> saw <WG1492> what <WG3588> was done, <WG1096> he glorified <WG1392> God, <WG2316> saying, <WG3004> Certainly <WG3689> this <WG3778> was a righteous <WG1342> man. <WG444>

And all <WG3956> the people <WG3793> that came <WG4836> together <WG4836> to that sight, <WG2335> beholding <WG2334> the things which were done, <WG1096> smote <WG5180> their breasts, <WG4738> and returned. <WG5290>
And all <WG3956> his acquaintance, <WG1110> and the women <WG1135> that followed <WG4870> him from Galilee, <WG1056> stood <WG2476> afar <WG3113> off, beholding <WG3708> these <WG5023> things.
And, behold, <WG2400> there was a man <WG435> named <WG3686> Joseph, <WG2501> a counselor; <WG1010> and he was a good <WG18> man, <WG435> and a just: <WG1342>

(The same <WG3778> had not consented <WG4784> to the counsel <WG1012> and deed <WG4234> of them;) he was of Arimathaea, <WG707> a city <WG4172> of the Jews: <WG2453> who <WG3739> also <WG2532> himself <WG846> waited <WG4327> for the kingdom <WG932> of God. <WG2316>
This <WG3778> man went <WG4334> to Pilate, <WG4091> and begged <WG154> the body <WG4983> of Jesus. <WG2424>

And he took <WG2507> it down, <WG2507> and wrapped <WG1794> it in linen, <WG4616> and laid <WG5087> it in a sepulcher <WG3418> that was hewn <WG2991> in stone, <WG2991> wherein <WG3757> never <WG3764> man <WG3762> before <WG3764> was laid. <WG2749>
And that day <WG2250> was the preparation, <WG3904> and the sabbath <WG4521> drew <WG2020> on. <WG2020>

And the women <WG1135> also, <WG2532> which <WG3748> came <WG4905> with him from Galilee, <WG1056> followed <WG2628> after, <WG2628> and beheld <WG2300> the sepulcher, <WG3419> and how <WG5613> his body <WG4983> was laid. <WG5087>
And they returned, <WG5290> and prepared <WG2090> spices <WG759> and ointments; <WG3464> and rested <WG2270> the sabbath <WG4521> day according <WG2596> to the commandment. <WG1785>
